humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a tumor size of 2.1 x 1.5 x 2 cm. According to the rules, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this pathology report, the tumor size is described as 2.1 x 1.5 x 2 cm in the cross section. According to the TNM staging system, a T2 stage cancer is defined as a tumor that is more than 2 cm in size but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
